Class PropFileReader

java.lang.Object
iscte.se.landmanagement.PropFileReader
public class PropFileReader extends Object
A utility class for reading and parsing property data from a `.csv` file. The file contains information about properties, including their attributes and coordinates.

  • Field Details

    • filePath

      private final Path filePath

    • properties

      private ArrayList<Property> properties

    • fileLines

      private List<String[]> fileLines

  • Constructor Details

    • PropFileReader

      public PropFileReader(Path filePath)
      Initializes a reader for a property `.csv` file based on the given file path.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path to the `.csv` file to be read.

  • Method Details

    • getFileLines

      public List<String[]> getFileLines()
      Retrieves the raw lines read from the `.csv` file.
      Returns:
      A list of string arrays, where each array represents a row in the `.csv` file.

    • getProperties

      public ArrayList<Property> getProperties()
      Retrieves the list of properties parsed from the `.csv` file.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of Property objects.

    • readFile

      public void readFile() throws Exception
      Reads the `.csv` file and parses its contents into raw lines. The parser uses `;` as the delimiter, as defined in the file format.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the file cannot be read (e.g., invalid path or file format issues).

    • readCoordinates

      protected ArrayList<Coordinates> readCoordinates(String line)
      Converts a string of coordinates from the `.csv` file into a list of Coordinates objects.
      Parameters:
      line - A string containing the coordinates of property corners.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of Coordinates representing the corners of the property.

    • convertToPropertiy

      public void convertToPropertiy()
      Converts the raw data read from the `.csv` file into a list of Property objects. The method validates the data to ensure properties have valid coordinates and the correct number of attributes.
